title: Data Scientist
description:
Overview The Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA), located in Seattle, Washington, is part of a dynamic collaboration among three organizations known nationally and internationally for their patient care and research: Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, University of Washington, and Seattle Children's. Over the past 25 years, these institutions have worked together to support their mission of adult and pediatric oncology patient care services, research and education.
SCCA’s Advanced Analytics Program harnesses the power of data to help SCCA deliver state of the art cancer care. The Data Scientist will join this growing team of innovative, results-oriented and collaborative professionals who employ advanced analytics to improve the experience of our patients, providers and staff. We combine data science expertise with a deep understanding of oncology data and strong clinical and business partnerships to deliver valuable products and demonstrate the extraordinary opportunities for analytics in healthcare. The Data Scientist is a critical member of this team who will inform our strategy, expand our capabilities, and deliver solutions that make SCCA a national leader in analytics for oncology.

Responsibilities Build positive, productive relationships with clinical and business partners to understand their information needs, identify data science opportunities, and ensure our products add value. Partners may include SCCA executives, directors and managers, providers, researchers, administrators, clinical staff, and outside institutions or agencies. Develop a robust understanding of SCCA’s data and data systems – financial, operational and clinical – to ensure effective, reliable, and responsible use of data. Build solutions that apply machine learning techniques to address complex business problems, derive actionable insights, and maximize decision-making confidence. Lead or participate in all aspects of solution development, including exploratory data analysis, feature selection and engineering, model build, testing and deployment. Create data visualizations, interpret/explain models, and present solutions to technical and non-technical audiences. Make recommendations, develop technical infrastructure and analytic competencies, and participate in project selection to inform and execute the strategy of the Advanced Analytics Program.

Qualifications Required BA/BS in computational science, healthcare informatics or similar quantitative degree 4+ years of applicable analytics or data science experience Extensive experience in exploratory data analysis, feature engineering and data visualization Proficiency in Python, R or Julia Experience with SQL relational databases Experience with statistical methodologies and machine learning techniques such as: neural networks, graphical models, ensemble methods and natural language processing Demonstrated ability to apply machine learning to solve complex business problems Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences High degree of personal initiative and strong problem-solving skills
Preferred Master’s degree or PhD in statistics, computational biology, healthcare informatics or similar quantitative degree Familiarity with healthcare industry and/or experience working with healthcare data, especially in oncology or population health Experience with software development, testing, and putting machine learning models into production Familiarity with one or more machine learning libraries or frameworks such as: PyTorch, Tensorflow and MXNet Experience using PPLs such as Stan, PyMC3 or Pyro for rapid development of generative models Experience with natural language processing for electronic medical records Strong data visualization skills

Our Commitment to Diversity We are committed to cultivating a workplace in which diverse perspectives and experiences are welcomed and respected. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and VEVRAA Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political ideology, or membership in any other legally protected class. We are an Affirmative Action employer. We encourage individuals with diverse backgrounds to apply and desire priority referrals of protected veterans. If due to a disability you need assistance/and or a reasonable accommodation during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to our Employee Services Center at escmail@fredhutch.org or by calling 206-667-4700.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst 1
description:
eXcell has been staffing IT professionals at the top Fortune 100 companies for over two decades. Whether you are looking for a lower-level IT position or a high-level executive position, we are here to help you find the right opportunity.

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst role identifies business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs. They work closely with clients and IT teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. They provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems.

Overview:
Work with clients (internal or external) to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI)
Build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues
Conduct analyses of functional business processes and functional business requirements and participate in the development of business cases in the support of process changes and/or IT projects
Design and document dashboards, alerts, and reports either on a regular recurring basis or as needed
Educate and train clients to use the data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms and content for the purpose of analysis and option exploration
Provide design support for the development of business intelligence solutions
Work on medium to complex and cross-functional IT and business intelligence solutions
May perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms
Research business problems and create models that help analyze these business problems

Qualifications:
Entry level-2 years of experience
Power BI experience
Data Analyst experience
Cosmos, Scope, & Kusto experience

W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor H1B visas at this time. **eXcell™ Supports Equal Employment Opportunity** eXcell™, a division of CompuCom® Systems, Inc., a global company headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, provides IT staffing services and solutions to Fortune 1000 companies as well as small and medium business. For more information, visit www.excell.com.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Role Title: Junior Data Analyst
Job Type: Contract/Full-time (W-2)
Estimated Start Date: Immediately
Contract Duration: Up to 18 months
Location: Redmond, WA

You want steady income, outstanding benefits and a job that lets you shine doing what you do best. But more than that, you want a role that will let you dive deepusing your talent, expertise, and drivewhile challenging you to continue to develop and contribute.

Whether you are seeking long-term contract opportunities or permanent job placement, Team Red Dog has the clients looking for your skills and experience.

The ideal candidate will have a commitment to accuracy, quality, and attention to details, with a team-oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills.

Build reports and maintain the datas integrity to partners amongst multiple data sources. Run data queries in Kusto and SQL and compare results against baseline data. Install test instances of data baselines in order to monitor settings. Track services against scorecard values and report on misses that do not meet qualifications. Proficiency in SQL, Kusto, and Azure Data Explorer query languages and data analytics software. Experience with Power BI a plus. Background working with machine learning or AI a plus. Very detail-oriented and proactive about addressing issues as they arise. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. title: Jr. Data Analyst
description:
At VOGLIO Digital Marketing we believe that success in digital marketing is not possible without the ability to manage big data. The Jr. Data Analyst is critical to providing the bridge between actionable advertising insights and raw data. We need a strong team player with a passion for all things data and a unique set of skills and interests.
This is a great position that can grow in many possible directions as our company grows. Must love working with business teams and data to understand problems and know how to be creative with data to find value.

Primary Responsibilities: Build and maintain client facing dashboards Monitor log errors to differentiate between false alarms and legitimate issues that must be addressed while developing strategies to reduce the rate of false alarms Facilitate data fluency throughout the company by maintaining wiki’s about BI tools and maintaining a list of approved metric definitions, database views, and data warehouse uses Collaborate with software engineers and data scientists to develop best practices and ensure a stable technology environment Detect data quality issues, identify their root causes, develop fixes and design auditing to capture future data issues

Qualifications: 2-3 years of experience in an analytical role A degree in a technology discipline with a proven history understanding business or a degree in a business related discipline with a proven history of building technology solutions SQL, you are fluent and would feel confident as a teaching assistant in a SQL 101 course Periscope, Tableau, Looker, or similar data visualization tools High energy and creativity; openness to new ideas/approaches; willingness to be flexible and do whatever you can to bring value to the team Certified in or experienced with at least one major digital ad platforms (Goggle Ads, BingAds, Facebook) Some experience with Python or Ruby required Experience with various AWS, Google, or Azure cloud based data services desirable Experience with BI/DW system architecture and DW data modeling desirable Experience with Git, Unix terminal, dimensional modeling, REST APIs all valued

Is This You? You are constructively critical but not judgmental because you know that good tech and good people always evolve You have the ability to describe analytical findings to business stakeholders and executives in a concise and actionable way You have many examples of times that you worked through online classes or books to teach yourself new technical skills that you wanted to learn Your long-term career goals are roles in data science and/or data engineering If you are interested in joining a fast-growing startup and you value relationships, diversity, balance, and growth we'd love to hear from you.
Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At ChemPoint, the Data Analyst collects, analyzes and presents data to improve decision making related to ChemPoint projects and essential business processes. This individual should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data and communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value. Works closely with various technology partners and business stakeholders to identify system and process needs, develop requirements, and determine analytical solutions. A DAY IN YOUR NEW CAREER: Requirements Gathering & Planning Translates business objectives into functional requirements and solution designs. Plans, designs, implements, and supports technology system changes while working closely with Product Owners and business stakeholders. Takes plans from conception through closing. Works with system architects and developers to ensure requirements are satisfied. Acts as a liaison to the business to address challenges or required modifications. Assists with backlog grooming and prioritization with the business. Data Analysis & Tasks: Develops queries and user reports to pull and evaluate data. Uses data to identify root cause problems in systems and processes. Develops routine metrics that provide data for process management and indicators for future improvement opportunities. Analyzes project requirements, constructs workflow charts and diagrams, determines system capabilities, and assist with writing technical specifications for new application design and enhancements. Partner with Business teams to understand their analytics needs and look for opportunities to enhance our analytical offering. Perform data analyses to answer business challenges and strategic questions. Builds testing plans, scenarios, and scripts to support QA efforts pertaining to newly developed analytical solutions Coordinates user acceptance testing (UAT) and participates in unit/system tests. Project & User Support: Develops training materials and provides training using multiple methods such as instructor-led sessions, webinars, one-on-one, etc. Provides end-user application support for all applicable applications. Includes troubleshooting errors, coordinating with vendors, managing support tickets, and testing solutions.
DESIRED BACKGROUND AND SKILLS: Bachelor’s degree from fully accredited four-year institution is or equivalent years of work experience required. Experience in Business-to-Business (B2B) service organization, preferably as a Business Intelligence Analyst or Data Analyst with 3+ years equivalent experience. Knowledge and experience working with MS Office Suite, with strong Excel skills. Querying and analyzing data using SQL from various database sources such as Microsoft SQL Server, Azure SQL, OLAP cubes. Knowledge of data analyst techniques and tools (R, Python, data modeling, statistical analysis). Direct experience developing business intelligence reporting (Power BI, SSRS, Tableau, etc.) Proficiency with data visualization tools and experience with building effective data visualizations. Ability to assess data quickly and convert to meaningful information. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively convey ideas and suggestions via multiple modes of communication. Exhibits versatility and adaptability engaging with customers, suppliers and external relationships. Ability to work well independently as well as within a team environment. Demonstrates sound judgment and critical thinking. Receptive to constructive feedback from peers and mentors. #LI-PC! Univar Solutions/ChemPoint is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on their race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected classification.

title: Data Analyst
description:
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Who are we?
Looking for a job that makes a real difference in our world today and one that you’ll be proud of when you look back in 20, 30 or 40 years? This is it. Clean Power Research® is advancing the energy transformation through cloud software that informs, streamlines and values energy-related decisions and processes for utilities, energy professionals and consumers.

We’re a growing company and award-winning innovator that counts seven of the top 10 U.S. utilities and many of the largest solar companies as our customers. We’re focused on expanding our market reach and impact with new software technologies that help solve the energy industry’s hardest problems.

At Clean Power Research, every employee has a seat at the table and an important role.
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">
Why work here?
Join a growing team of software and energy veterans from companies such as Microsoft, Amazon, Autodesk and Pacific Gas & Electric who are shaping the future of clean energy
Bring your passion and ideas to the table
Use your creativity to solve hard problems and make tough decisions
Work in a start-up like environment coupled with the stability and customer base of an established, profitable company
Realize work-life balance; we like to see our families, friends and pets at night!
Join a growing company that expects you to grow with us and invests in your growth
Clean Power Research offers competitive compensation and benefits to full-time employees including medical/dental/vision, paid vacation, paid holidays, a bonus plan, and a 401(k) plan with matching.
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">
What you’ll be doing as a Data Analyst
The Data Analyst will work closely with data scientists, software engineers and product managers to design, develop and test data science, machine learning, and statistical methods across our multifaceted, enterprise SaaS platform.

This platform, comprised of our PowerClerk®, WattPlan®, and SolarAnywhere®, enables utilities and the energy industry to inform, streamline and value energy-related decisions and processes. Across our products, a variety of best-in-class, highly unique datasets are growing every day, from a nationwide database of 1 km resolution solar irradiance data derived from satellite image feeds, to a continuous data feed of customer interest in clean energy technologies.

Clean Power Research is leveraging these datasets to solve new customer problems. The Data Analyst will identify and research additional data sets, conduct rigorous technical and data analysis and collaborate with the team to elevate these data sets in new and existing software products.

The person in this role will perform the technical analysis of irradiance and weather data, among other data sets, and validate new data models for historical and forecast weather data applications. Additionally, the Data Analyst will work alongside the product management team to conduct industry-leading research in the application of data science to solar irradiance and weather data prediction.

The Data Analyst will also provide internal technical support for marketing, sales and business development functions and can represent the company at technical conferences through publications and presentations.
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">
Duties & Responsibilities
Analyze and validate product capability and data accuracy, both for customer engagement and marketing business needs
Process, transform, and experiment with high volumes of data to optimize model accuracy
Identify new potential data sources to enhance model performance
Apply a procedural framework to assess the performance of a variety of models and quickly identify the most suitable approaches
Identify and evangelize opportunities to leverage data science approaches and key metrics to validate model changes and continuously monitor model performance
Work closely with consultants and researchers to support projects where data science and data analysis expertise is needed
Communicate with Clean Power Research customers on the details of our model outputs and approaches used
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">Who you are
MS or PhD in engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field
2+ years of experience in a professional environment having an analytical role involving data analysis techniques
Exceptional analytical and problem solving capabilities, including the ability to logically and efficiently structure ambiguous problems, identify sources of data, conduct complicated analyses, identify key insights and recommend model improvements
Coding skills (using SQL, Python, R or similar language) for analyzing data and prototyping statistical and machine learning models
Familiar with advanced techniques in data science, including statistical analysis, data visualization, and some machine learning techniques
Exposure to remote sensing applications, like satellite-based measurement techniques is a plus
Strong working knowledge of statistics fundamentals and aptitude for working with large data sets to perform statistical analysis
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
Superior organizational skills, ability to multitask across several concurrent projects
Passion for clean tech, solar energy or renewables
<h3 class="jobSectionHeader">How to Apply
lick on the link below to submit a cover letter detailing your interest in the renewable energy space along with your resume. Due to the large number of applicants for our positions, we regret that we can only respond to candidates who meet our requirements.

Clean Power Research is located in Kirkland near the intersection of SR520 and Lake Wash. Blvd NE (Greater Seattle Area). Local, full-time, in-office candidates only, please.

Clean Power Research is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. The company’s employment decisions are based on merit, competence, performance and business needs.

title: Business Analyst
description:
<h4 class="jobSectionHeader">Business Analyst
As a Business Analyst on Destiny, you will conduct analysis and build reporting tools to inform our live services and in-game store design. You will report to the Sr. Manager of Destiny Analytics, and partner with Product Management, Data Engineering, and other Analysts to empower the studio with the data and insights they need to make decisions.
<h4 class="jobSectionHeader">Responsibilities
Produce dashboards and ad-hoc analysis to monitor and evaluate our live operations performance
Partner with Product Managers to build presentations to communicate live business performance
Quantify opportunities for new MTX or live ops initiatives
Design repeatable measurement frameworks to evaluate systems over time
Partner with Data Engineering to ensure data quality in reports and dashboards
<h4 class="jobSectionHeader">Required Skills
3 to 5 years of Business Analytics experience
The ability to efficiently communicate results through data
Intermediate SQL skills
Knowledge of basic statistics (summary statistics, distribution analysis, and significance testing)
Experience building clear, accessible dashboards for a non-technical audience (Tableau preferred)
A passion for collaborating with stakeholders
High bias for action – the drive to take project requirements and see them through to completion by navigating blocking issues
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality and polish
The ability to effectively communicate technical insights to a non-technical audience
<h4 class="jobSectionHeader">Nice To Have Skills
Python or R for data analysis
Experience working in a fast-paced, enterprise-scale live operations environment with many competing priorities
Experience with time-series forecasting (academic exposure would also help)
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field
A love of games (Bonus points for Action-MMO experience like Destiny)

title: Data Coordinator
description:
What you’ll be doing…
Tableau is looking for a Data Coordinator who will be responsible for supporting the triaging and intake of tickets from the business community along with monitoring and responding to order processing issues. This role is part of the Enterprise Applications team and will help usher tickets through the triage process and coordinate the resolution and escalation of production support issues.
Some of the things you’ll be doing include…
Act as a liaison between Enterprise Applications and internal customers; understand and help provide explanations to non‐technical people about the functionality of the different systems
Review, triage, and assign incoming requests to the Product teams within Enterprise Applications
Scope tickets for clarity of issue, permissions, and perform initial analysis of issues
Support business and technical experts to help troubleshoot and resolve production support issues
Help propose solutions and process flows based on the requirements gathered
Coordinate End of Quarter support plans for Enterprise Applications
Provide initial order processing support for Customer Operations
Develop operational and business knowledge of how systems are used by internal customers
Provide consistent updates to ticket reporters, while following up with dev and analyst teams to support issue resolution
Effectively document and communicate issues via ticketing system, email, and collaboration channels
Help create and maintain internal troubleshooting documents for commonly reported issues
Help prepare reporting related to ticket inflow analysis and make it available to stakeholders
Provide tier 1 administration of select SaaS applications as needed
Who you are…
Experienced. Outstanding customer service skills including professional collaboration tool and email etiquette and strong presentation skills
Educated. BS/BA in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or equivalent
Leadership. You can lead and mentor others and can remain calm during high stress and high visibility situations.
Problem Solver. You love finding problems and taking on the most difficult of challenges. You know how to propose solutions and push them towards completion.
Superb Communication. You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it.
A True Team Player. Willingness to jump in as needed, and the experience and professionalism required to meet objectives
Relentlessly High Standards. You're not satisfied with the status quo. You thrill in your accomplishments but also know it's about doing and improving.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders; employees are expected to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard, helping Tableau continue to build one of the best companies in the world.
#LI-BF1
Tableau Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Tableau Software is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry. Our culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!

title: Business Data Analyst (Entry Level)
description:
MIRACORP Inc., is a veteran, women-owned firm specializing in federal government contract services. One of our competitive advantages is that we provide services to our customers with a standard of excellence that is unmatched. MIRACORP believes our employees are the cornerstone for our success.
We are seeking an entry-level Business Data Analyst to work at our federal customer site in Auburn, WA and to join our collaborative, innovative, customer-centric culture. If you have basic knowledge in technical fields including but not limited to finance, accounting, information technology, research and analysis, or other program support fields, then please read on!
Specific tasks include but are not limited to the following:
Works in support of the general management and business operation of a particular program, department, or office.
Provides data analysis and research for specific projects.
Supports managers and a variety of tasks and projects to meet deadlines.
Continuously exercises discretion and independent judgment on the analysis, planning, and/or implementation of important program initiatives.
Your Experience:
Associate's Degree or equivalent experience. Equivalent experience includes:
4+ years' experience supporting program data analysis activities with no related degree; OR
2+ years' experience supporting program data analysis activities with related Associate's Degree; OR
No experience with a related BA or BS degree.
Specializes in data analysis in one or more of the following areas: tax; finance; accounting; budgeting; auditing; quality control; research; legal and regulatory compliance; administration, and other similar management and operational activities.
Experience using the Smartsheet software application.
Superior customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Ability to take the initiative and use independent judgment.
Preferred:
Has a Public Trust Clearance
Why Consider This Opportunity:
Great benefit package with benefits that start on date of hire.
401 (k) employer match, with 100% immediate vesting.
Work environment where you have a lot of independence.
Ability to work with a purpose and make an impact.
Work with a Manager and peers that are passionate about customers.
Work for an employer where core values are not just written on paper but lived.
MIRACORP is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Veterans are encouraged to apply!

title: sourcing analyst
description:
Job Summary and Mission
This position contributes to Starbucks success by analyzing complex data and market industry information from multiple sources to develop strategic sourcing recommendations. Develops new ways to analyze sources for data and information. Conducts opportunity assessments, benchmarking, cost modeling and root cause analysis to develop sourcing recommendations. Collaborates effectively internally and with suppliers to gather data and develop analytical insights
Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.
Summary of Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:
Sourcing Strategy:
Support the Development of Sourcing Strategy by identifying and applying knowledge of key industry players, competitors and market dynamics to develop market analysisIntegrate and analyze complex data and market industry information from multiple sources to develop strategic sourcing recommendationsProficiently utilize sources for data and insightsConduct opportunity assessments, benchmarking, cost modeling and root cause analysis to develop sourcing recommendations. Supplier Engagement and Management:Collaborate effectively with suppliers and potential suppliers to gather data, develop analytical insights, and sourcing recommendationsAssist in developing supplier assessments, score cards and other analytics to enable the team to effectively manage supplier performance - - Assist in developing information for negotiation strategies
Cross-Functional Projects:
Assist in managing components of cross-functional projectsDevelop competency in program and project management tools and techniques.Effectively and independently manage multiple projects and deadlines
Leadership and Teamwork:
Lead across peer groups and demonstrate leadership, including cross-functional manager and senior manager levels.Operates within peer group and leadership infrastructure to ensure that top quality data and recommendations are developed
Summary of Experience
Analytical, planning, procurement, supply chain or other relevant experience (2+)
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activitiesAnalytical: Excellent analytical skillsProcurement: Working knowledge of market analysis, sourcing category strategy, supplier relationship management â€˜should-costâ€™ models, and negotiationsLegal: Knowledge of critical procurement legal requirements and contracting best practicesEthics: Knowledge of business ethics and Starbucks Ethical Sourcing RequirementsInfluence: Ability to lead and influence peer groups on difficult complex strategy and negotiation recommendationsCommunication: Exceptional communication both written and oralSystems: Knowledge of Excel, Oracle, BI Apps, charting programs, PowerPoint, and others
Job Scope
Annual Managed Expenses
Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals.

We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com

title: Business Analyst, Data Strategy and Reporting
description:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance- A Fortune 100 Company!
As a Centralized Reporting Analyst on the Economics Business Lines Product Reporting team, you will own the reporting tool kits for multiple lines of business, develop complex reporting automation, as well as perform large data mining for relevant insights that can drive profitable growth in BI. To address the business priorities for your assigned tool kits, you will collaborate extensively with stakeholders and partner teams to ensure end-user requirements for reporting are satisfied across all users. You will design and build a robust library of flexible reporting tools and dashboards, retire low value reports, and consolidate redundancies. By leveraging technology SAS/SQL/VBA/Tableau/Essbase and best practices, you will standardize, automate, and institutionalize data and reporting solutions through a centralized distribution platform.
Responsibilities: Participates in requirement and report design sessions with cross-functional teams. Produce accurate, consistent and timely reporting by extracting information from various applications and systems, manipulating data and developing user friendly final outputs leveraging SAS, SQL, VBA, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, MicroStrategy. Identify reporting processes that are inefficient and create/change processes that will lead to measurable gains in data quality and reporting processing time. Work in partnership with other groups to develop automated reports in the most effective medium. Manage life cycle of new analytics from assessment, initiation, development, staging, production, and institutionalization. Produce and maintain inventories of standard reports. Lead projects to create new reports, data models, and information tools based on your insight or business need. Proficient with tools such as SQL Studio, SAS, Tableau, and MicroStrategy to produce, maintain, develop, and enhance routine reports, new reports, and ad-hoc requests. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in business, economics, or other quantitative field; minimum of 3 to 5 years or more of relevant work experience. Proficiency with SAS and/or SQL is strongly preferred. Proficiency in Tableau, MicroStrategy, Power BI, Excel, VBA or other business intelligence tools required. Strong planning, organizational, analytical, decision making and communication skills; strong business acumen. Experience with databases and the ability to manipulate and query large data sets required. Benefits: We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits.
Overview: At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

title: Mid
description:

title: Intelligence Analyst
description:
NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. NSA's priorities are driven by externally developed and validated intelligence requirements, provided to the NSA by the President, his national security team, and their staffs through the National Intelligence Priorities Framework. NSA Intelligence Analysts are expected to take an inclusive approach to problem solving and mission accomplishment by frequently engaging with partners, enablers and customers across the Intelligence Community.
Description of Position
Intelligence Analysts have the power to influence world affairs. They provide the most complete possible foreign signals intelligence picture to U.S. policy makers and military commanders, and seek creative solutions to answer analytical questions.
Intelligence Analysts are at the forefront of implementing NSA's mission, and they do so in a variety of ways:
- Research and understand foreign intelligence targets, how they operate and how they fit in the larger geo-political context
- Apply new techniques and develop creative solutions to address analytic problems such as synthesizing large volumes of data and disparate sources of information
- Demonstrate a firm understanding of the communications environment and technology trends of foreign intelligence targets
- Craft written assessments of foreign intelligence that provide unique insight into target intentions unavailable from other intelligence disciplines
- Work independently and collaborate effectively (both within NSA and with other analysts in the Intelligence Community) in research, analysis, and reporting
Skills
The ideal candidate is intellectually curious, has a strong desire for learning and is also:
- well-organized and able to handle multiple assignments
- a strong written and oral communicator
- able to synthesize information to solve complex problems
- able to work effectively across several different functional areas in a collaborative environment
- able to provide timely and accurate customer service
Coursework, knowledge and experience in one or more of the following is desired:
- Critical foreign languages
- Computer science or networking
- Cyber security
- Data modeling, mining, or science
- Metadata analysis
- Quantitative / Statistical analysis
- Research methodology
- Social network analysis
- Telecommunications
- Target development
- Topical or Regional studies relevant to national security
Relevant Internships, extracurricular activities, and/or foreign study are also considered.
Prior military without a degree but with intelligence analysis cryptologic experience will be considered.
Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
On-the job training, Internal NSA courses, and external training will be made available based on the need and experience of the selectee.
Monday - Friday, with basic 8hr/day work requirements between 0600 and 1800 (flexible).
NSA hires for a variety of locations to include: Maryland, Georgia, Hawaii, Texas, Colorado, and other locations.
Position Summary
Intelligence Analysis has the power to influence world affairs. The Intelligence Analysis mission encourages both independent and collaborative partnering (both within NSA and with other analysts in the Intelligence Community) while seeking creative solutions to analytical questions. Your skills in research, analysis, reporting, planning, and advising will ensure senior leaders are provided with time-sensitive cryptologic support for strategic and operational level planning across the full range of DoD and U.S. Government operations for integrated information and cyberspace operations. This wide array of skills helps protect U.S. government information systems and provides the most complete possible foreign signals intelligence picture to U.S. policy makers and military commanders.
Qualifications
Salary Range: $69,581 - $108,422 (Full Performance)
*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position.
Entry is with a high school diploma or GED plus 7 years of relevant experience, or an Associate's degree plus 5 years of relevant experience, or a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience, or a Master's degree plus 1 year of relevant experience, or a Doctoral degree and no experience.
Degree in a liberal arts field (e.g., English, History, Communications, Languages and Cultures, International Relations, and Political Science) is preferred, but a degree in any field is acceptable.
Relevant experience must be in aspects of intelligence analysis (e.g., target development, social network analysis, and metadata analysis). Note: For development program hires, the experience requirement may be met with more general analytic, problem solving, and/or investigative experience.
Salary Range: $99,172 - $152,352 (Senior)
*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position.
Entry is with a high school diploma or GED plus 10 years of relevant experience, or an Associate's plus 8 years of relevant experience, or a Bachelor's degree plus 6 years of relevant experience, or a Master's degree plus 4 years of relevant experience, or a Doctoral degree plus 2 years of relevant experience.
Degree in a liberal arts field (e.g., English, History, Communications, Languages and Cultures, International Relations, and Political Science) is preferred, but a degree in any field is acceptable.
Relevant experience must be in aspects of intelligence analysis (e.g., target development, social network analysis, and metadata analysis).
Salary Range: $137,849 - $166,500 (Expert)
*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position.
Entry is with a high school diploma or GED plus 13 years of relevant experience, or an Associate's degree plus 11 years of relevant experience, or a Bachelor's degree plus 9 years of relevant experience, or a Master's degree plus 7 years of relevant experience, or a Doctoral degree plus 5 years of relevant experience.
Degree in a liberal arts field (e.g., English, History, Communications, Languages and Cultures, International Relations, and Political Science) is preferred, but a degree in any field is acceptable.
Relevant experience must be in aspects of intelligence analysis (e.g., target development, social network analysis, and metadata analysis).
How To Apply - External
To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply' button located at the top right of this posting. After completing the application for the first time, or reviewing previously entered information, and clicking the 'Submit' button, you will receive a confirmation email. Please ensure your spam filters are configured to accept emails from noreply@intelligencecareers.gov.
***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.
This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.
Please note that you may be asked a series of questions depending on the position you apply for. Your responses will be used as part of the screening process of your application and will assist in determining your eligibility for the position. Be sure to elaborate on experiences in your resume. Failure to provide the required information or providing inaccurate information will result in your application not being considered for this position. Only those applicants who meet the qualifications for the position will be contacted to begin employment processing.
Please Note: Job Posting could close earlier than the closing date due to sufficient number of applicants or position no longer available. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
DCIPS Disclaimer
The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

title: Budget/Data Visualization Analyst
description:
Are you ready to build a career in a rapidly changing world? Do you enjoy working cutting edge technology and solving difficult problems? Are you interested in working across a range of areas from program/project management office support, financial management, independent verification and validation, system testing, and beyond? If so, Oculus Group could be the place for you! 
 Oculus Group LLC, an award-winning, minority Woman-Owned Small Business (WOSB) headquartered in Arlington, VA, is a premier IT service provider for various federal clients. Oculus has been providing high quality, cost-effective IT services support to our clients since 2000. From the beginning, our vision is to be the preferred and most trusted resource for our clients. 
 Oculus is seeking a Budget/Data Visualization Analyst who will be primarily responsible for ongoing budget portfolio support, day-to-day analysis and manipulation using Excel and Power BI, completing deliverables, and ad-hoc client support. This includes budget data analysis and briefing development in support of senior personnel. This position operates in a highly collaborative, client-facing, environment with interactions with all levels of government personnel and other contractor teams daily. 
 The candidate must be willing and able to physically work on-site at our customer’s facility in Washington, DC (metro accessible). The ideal candidate will be a professional, proactive, detail-oriented, and motivated self-starter. 
 Primary Responsibilities:  
 Work within Federal Planning, Programming, Budget and Execution (PPBE) process, or with federal budget data analysis and briefing creationWork with stakeholders to understand their business needs and create reports and visualizations based on business needsCreate new dashboards and reports that synthesize distributed data sourcesResearch, analyze and consolidate large amounts of information into consumable formats (briefs/graphics)Develop concise and accurate data analysis and clearly communicate findingsComfortable working with and presenting to senior leadership, managers, budget staff and external stakeholders. (The ideal candidate must be a consummate team player, with experience working in a collaborative environment, including relationship building with both internal and external stakeholders)Meet tight deadlines and work with minimal supervision 
 Qualifications and Requirements 
 Bachelor’s Degree with Business or Accounting concentrationMinimum 4 years of government or consulting experience4-7 years working within Federal Planning, Programming, Budget and Execution (PPBE) processAdvanced skills in MS ExcelExperience with the Business Intelligence tool (Power BI)Experience in visualization design to include dashboards, executive briefings, or front-end visualizationsExperience using MS Office Tools Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)Ability to learn quickly and brainstorm solutions to complex problemsAbility to professionally deliver information (both in oral and written) and assist government staff in seeking creative solutionsFlexible and able to deal with competing priorities, multi-taskingAble to creatively solve problems and find solutions to challengesExhibits the capability for strong focus and attention to detail and be proficient with numerical analysis.Experience in government consulting; recent experience with Department of Veterans Affairs preferredAbility to obtain a Public Trust clearance 
 Oculus’ Culture 
 Oculus Group LLC attracts and retains highly qualified professionals so that we provide excellent work to our clients, a workplace that rewards our people appropriately for their abilities and their accomplishments, offers opportunities to grow professionally, and is free from distractions that would hinder job performance. Our positive and supportive culture encourages our employees to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their strengths and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, and confident. 
 How you will grow 
 From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to tuition reimbursement, our employees have opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career at Oculus. 
 Benefits 
 At Oculus, we know that great people make a great organization. title: Billing & Collections Data Analyst
description:
The Collections Data Analyst provides support and recommendations to the WSSC Billing and Revenue Protection division, based upon insight generated through world class data analytics and predictive techniques. The incumbent provides the primary business analysis and project management support for revenue assurance and collections activities to deliver efficient and effective service to internal and external customers.
In this role, they facilitate the end to end collections strategy design to ensure effective and optimal use of resources and minimization of delinquencies while reducing revenue leakage and enabling customers to maintain service. Incumbent operates with limited supervision and is responsible for training colleagues.
Essential Functions Performs in-depth analysis on delinquent accounts, reviews existing collections strategies and provides Senior Management with proposals to help drive positive customer outcomes and revenue protection. Collaborates with Customer Service and Utility Services to drive real and constant business change. Completes analytics work with minimal oversight and brings suggestions forward to drive direction. Analyzes data using tools such as SQL, VBA, and MS Excel. Manages projects to enhance business performance and drive process improvements. Reviews the entire collections and credit risk lifecycle to help ensure a continuous and seamless customer journey. Uses analytical approaches such as Variable Analysis & Segmentation, Net Present Value and Forecasting, test and learn techniques, alongside strong data extraction skills to suggest ways to optimize billing and collections strategies. Proposes and designs new strategies that improve customer engagement and operational effectiveness. Performs Root Cause Analysis to understand limitations of the current collections strategy and propose improvements. Evaluates and maintains customer payment arrangement plans and collectors tools to use in delinquency resolution. Influences design of and ensures optimization of any collections programs. Ensures strategies are compliant with all regulatory rules and requirements. Works with IT and other departments to ensure proposals are implementable, implemented robustly and monitored/controlled effectively.
Other Functions Develops ad hoc training to enable succession planning options and broaden overall capability. Build relationships with key stakeholders across business, finance, risk, operations to enable support for collections strategies. Performs other related duties as assigned.
Work Environment And Physical Demands N/A
Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Ability to drive work forward independently and collaborate as a member of a team to push thinking and take projects to business leading solutions. Given a ‘theme’ has the ability to independently analyze, draw conclusions and make recommendations. Good communication skills. Strong work ethic & team skills. Ability to manage a project to agreed schedule, budget, scope, and quality. Ability to put our customers’ needs first. Ability to contribute to an inspired workplace that is focused on success and treating our customers fairly. Ability to demonstrate integrity and respect within the workplace through dealings with colleagues and customers. Ability to be innovative and creative in approach – seeking new opportunities to improve our customer experience, our brand, the business and ourselves. Process mapping and business analysis skills.
Minimum Education, Experience Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Finance, Statistics or a related field. Project management experience. OR High school diploma or equivalent. 6 years data analysis experience. Project management experience.

title: Cost and Pricing Analyst
description:
TechnoServe is a leader in harnessing the power of the private sector to help people lift themselves out of poverty. As a nonprofit organization operating in 29 countries, we work with enterprising men and women in the developing world to build competitive farms, businesses, and industries. By linking people to information, capital, and markets, we have helped millions to create lasting prosperity for their families and communities. With 50 years of proven results, TechnoServe believes in the power of private enterprise to transform lives. 
 The Cost and Pricing Analyst develops budgets and cost proposals for new business across TechnoServe’s regional divisions, and review budgets developed by others. This position is a critical member of the proposal team, providing input to maximize the cost effectiveness and competitiveness of program design. 
 Position Requirements:  
 Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Finance, Economics, or related field, with minimum of 2 years of experience, preferably in international development.Proven analytic and budgeting skills, including the ability to model the costs of different program designs.Advanced proficiency in Excel.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Strong organizational and problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Ability to work independently and efficiently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.Excellent oral and written English communication skills; able to effectively interact with diverse groups of domestic and international colleagues; Spanish and/or French language skills highly desirable; Portuguese skills also desirable. 
 Primary Functions & Responsibilities:  
 Review and analyze donor solicitations to understand the terms and conditions and convey any unique or risky contract terms to Proposal Managers and other relevant staff. Prepare contractual clarification questions in response to solicitations.Adapt standard budget templates to meet specific needs of funder solicitations.Develop cost proposals for new business across TechnoServe’s regional divisions in coordination with the Operations and Program Development teams, ensuring alignment with the technical proposal and budgeting for full cost recovery while also making a strong business case for the value for money offered by TechnoServe.Review cost proposals developed by other cost and pricing staff or regional financial staff to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance.Enter new award budgets into TechnoServe’s financial system; assist in developing customized financial report templates for new awards to ensure compliance with donor reporting requirements; and support handover of proposal budgets to program managers.Support maintenance of a library of cost data used for new cost proposals.Travel may be required; must be able to travel on short notice for up to two weeks at a time.Other duties and tasks as assigned.

title: Data Analyst
description:
ABOUT THE DC PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL BOARD (DC PCSB)
Every day, we're changing the way public education operates in Washington, DC—making it better for students, families, and communities. In fact, the DC Public Charter School Board (DC PCSB) currently does that for 43,000+ public charter school students who deserve a better education and a brighter future.
This work matters.
ABOUT THE ROLE
That's where you come in. As part of our data team, you'll be responsible for collecting, maintaining, reporting, and analyzing data about DC's public charter schools, specifically for the School Quality Reports (as known as the Performance Management Framework or PMF) as well as other academic data reporting. You'll provide quality data analysis to public charter schools and DC PCSB staff. Along with the rest of the data team, you'll continue to help move us from manual analysis towards automation to more efficiently meet the needs of our fast-paced environment.
You'll work with and support school leaders, school-based data managers, and DC PCSB staff on the PMF, with a focus on the adult education sector. As part of the Financial and Academic Quality team, you're an essential part of the process, preparing for PMF task force meetings and technical guide updates. Your analysis of schools' academic data for charter reviews or renewals supports the entire organization.
Your SQL skills will help us automate the process of moving data that feeds into our QuickBase and Looker applications, and you'll use your data visualization skills with a variety of audiences.
You're more than a data analyst, you're the one we trust to educate and support school leaders regarding DC PCSB's practices and policies. You're great with verbal and written communication, and you'll also work with the team to develop easy-to-read dashboards and visualizations to communicate school performance data to the public and school leaders.
As our go-to person for all adult education data questions, you'll learn our internal systems and be able to make updates and changes to the processes, provide the team and leadership with strong data analysis, and proactively make recommendations to improve our products and our processes.
Competencies and Qualifications:
You are detail oriented, independent, and able to develop innovative solutions to difficult problems. You're comfortable with large quantities of data and, technically speaking, you have strong SQL and Excel experience as well as an additional scripting language such as Python or R.
With a strong customer service focus, you see change requests as an opportunity to improve both our products and the quality of education provided to DC students. You have strong writing skills, strong visualization skills, and a strong work ethic.
Compensation
Salary is competitive and commensurate with prior experience in a similar role. DC PCSB offers a comprehensive benefits plan. The salary band for this position is $70,000 - $80,000.
DC PCSB is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a culturally diverse staff. We strive to foster an environment where everyone feels included. We believe that when people bring their unique identities, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to our community, we are able to truly achieve excellence in our work.

title: Data Analyst Supporting the FBI Healthcare Fraud Section
description:
Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers SAIC and AECOM, has a vacancy for a Data Analyst supporting Health Care Fraud Unit of the FBI.

Join the Health Care Fraud Unit and be part of a dynamic team that not only supports the FBI headquarters, but also provides opportunities for the team to participate in "Temporary Duty Assignments (TDY) supporting the FBI Field Offices. This unique opportunity allows employees to interact with colleagues in various locations, while also providing an opportunity to develop new skills as you grow your career with one of the most prestigious organizations in the law enforcement community.

The day to day environment consists of meaningful work at a steady pace while ensuring quality work products are produced without the added pressures of hard deadlines. Employees are encouraged to participate in teambuilding/bonding activities to include office celebrations, birthdays, anniversaries, milestones, awards and yes, even an occasional happy hour.

Additional office related benefits include:
Flexible work schedules; Overtime; Short-term TDY Travel; and Variety of special projects A Data Analyst executes the following duties:
Provide organization and management of case files Review data (completeness of information, proper execution) Extract data from data base Obtain additional information from other investigative agencies/data base Establish/maintain physical file Prepare notices/advertisements Receive, suspense petitions, claims, process sharing requests Reconcile inconsistencies Prepare declarations Gather information and organize investigative package Verify case files and case tracking system Maintain internal status information on the disposition of all forfeited assets Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data Conduct and reconcile inventories Distribute and receive documents Assist lead analyst or official in obtaining/collecting all documents/information to complete case file Provide administrative information and assistance concerning case to other investigative agencies, local law enforcement agencies, US Attorney, and other DOJ processing units, and higher headquarters Extract data from agency data base for management and program reports Perform word processing relevant to case documentation Perform data entry relevant to case Candidates already possessing an Active Top Secret clearance are strongly preferred and are given first consideration.

A Data Analyst must meet the following qualifications:
High School diploma, bachelor's Degree preferred Ability to review and analyze data and information from multiple sources Ability to establish case/project files Ability to enter and retrieve data from data bases Ability to prepare and format management reports Ability to manipulate, transfer, and compute and print information Ability to create and manipulate spreadsheets Ability to prepare and correct reports and correspondence using word processing software Candidates already possessing an Active TS clearance are strongly preferred. Preference will be given to qualified applicants who are familiar with the specific policies, processes, procedures, and practices of this customer, and who are cleared to commence work immediately. Ability to obtain and maintain an Top Secret Security Access This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation.

title: Data Analyst I
description:
Constellis was established in 2010 by a group of operators and investors who sought to combine best-in-class brands, assets and people within the complex risk management industry. Today, the leading provider of risk management and operational support services worldwide, Constellis combines the legacy capabilities and experience of ACADEMI, AMK9, Triple Canopy, Olive Group, OMNIPLEX, Centerra, Edinburgh International, Strategic Social and all of their affiliates. From life support, procurement, operations and maintenance to high-threat protection, training, C4I systems integration and crisis response, Constellis helps its clients achieve and sustain success, no matter where they are in the world. Constellis operates in approximately 40 countries with regional offices in Africa, the Americas, Europe and the Middle East. Constellis is headquartered just outside of Washington, D.C. in Reston, VA.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Maintain information in all MegaCenter systems to include but not limited to: Buildings.

Projects.

Contact clean up.

Document alarm account notes/instructions/procedures in the appropriate areas in an alarm account profile.
Create and delete accounts in the required MegaCenter system(s).

Contact government agency contacts for current information regarding alarm and building accounts.
Contacts
Validate and update information within officer and contact profiles in the MegaCenter information system.
Perform quality assurance for overall accuracy of all MegaCenter information systems.

Exclude times in dispatcher events for delayed calls, assist in providing information management support to include but not limited to project management services.
Send quality review emails to the dispatch center if a change to an event is required.

Create, document, and disseminate reports upon request to FPS Headquarters personnel, FPS Regional personnel, MegaCenter Management.
Create, edit, or delete accounts in the current MegaCenter system.

Maintain a level of expert knowledge of the MegaCenter information systems.
Assist in providing training to personnel on the operations of each system to include, but not limited to: Alarm Monitoring Software, WebRMS/LEIMS or other information management software, MIST and MegaN.

QUALIFICATIONS:

High School diploma or GED
Computer Skills - Utilizes a personal computer with word processing, spreadsheet and related software with reasonable speed and accuracy.
Proficient in Word, Excel, and data entry.
WHY CONSTELLIS?

With operations across every major continent and an annual revenue of $1.7 billion dollars, Constellis provides a wide array of opportunities for individuals looking to build successful careers in a fast-paced, growing industry. Legal, moral and ethical business practices remain at the cornerstone of our culture and Constellis continues to be recognized for our emphasis on quality and compliance. This strong track-record of performance is supported by our deep relationships across key government agencies and blue chip commercial customers. With more than 21,000 personnel worldwide, the majority of whom are military or law enforcement veterans, we leverage our employees' ambition and passion for creating a safer world. Our extensive operational expertise is augmented by our intimate knowledge of economies, communities and cultures. As a result, we share a willingness to support complex operations in some of the world's most demanding places.

title: Data Collection and Analysis Lead
description:
About the Job 
 GSX is looking to hire a Data Collection and Analysis Lead for a full-time position supporting the development, maintenance, and sustainment of an enterprise-wide compliance program. The Data Collection and Analysis Lead will assist the Voluntary Education Office in maintaining multiple assessments, performing audits, and collecting data to assess criteria associated with signed Memorandum of Understandings (MOUs) with various higher education institutions. The specific position on the team will collect and analyze data related to compliance relating to tuition assistance for active-duty military. Ideal candidates will have experience applying both quantitative and qualitative methods of analysis and will have proficiency in analytic tools such as Excel. The successful candidate for this position will also be collaborative, flexible, and agile in response to emerging program priorities. 
 Responsibilities 
 Work in coordination with analysts and consultants to determine risk of non-compliance via assessment tools, data collection, and statistical modeling.Assist with the maintenance of the existing evaluation tool(s) that efficiently and effectively measure non-compliance with existing MOUs.Analyze and aggregate data from public data collected from over 2,200 higher education institutions.Complete web verification form to verify and rate an institution’s compliance with MOU.Collect data and rate information provided from higher education institutions’ completion of self-assessments.Manage multiple overlapping cycles of data collection.Compile ratings from multiple assessments and analyze data to determine potential non-compliance.Assist in the creation of and review Corrective Action Plans sent to institutions that are found to be not in compliance.Assist with additions, deletions, or changes to assessment forms, collection techniques, and data elements in order to efficiently utilize the best methods of collecting data to determine potential non-compliance.Communicate with clients, colleagues, and stakeholders to present results of assessment process.Assist in the generation of Monthly Status Reports.Develop process documentation such as standard operating procedures and job aids to support continuous improvement of the compliance program.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description:
Job Details Description The American Hospital Association (AHA) is a national organization that represents and serves all types of hospitals, health care networks, and their patients and communities. We are currently seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst for Data Strategy in Chicago. POSITION PURPOSE The Healthcare Data Analyst is responsible for compiling, organizing, and analyzing healthcare and business data sets using analytic software tools. Responsibilities include research/analytic study design, data exploration and preparation, data analysis, and report preparation. This position will work with others on the data team and with individuals who work with data across the AHA.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Perform data research, preparation, analysis, and reporting on AHA’s complex organizational data. Develop and apply algorithms and/or models with the goal of answering business questions. Develop metrics and benchmarks for comparative purposes. Develop reports and visualizations of data, which clearly and concisely illustrate analytic results. Prepare and present findings for use in decision-making and/or presentations. Develop standards, procedures, and quality control measures for conducting project analytics to ensure consistency among organizational components and compliance with stakeholder requirements. Participate on committees and task forces and advise other organization staff, across the AHA, who work with data. Understand the AHA’s data resources and business cases in order to identify potential opportunities for focused investigations. Other duties as assigned by supervisor.
QUALIFICATIONS Education: Required Education: Bachelor's Degree

Desired fields of study: Healthcare Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics, Epidemiology, or a similar quantitative field. Years of experience may be substituted for education. Experience: 3-5 years experience with a minimum of 3 years of experience with data analysis. Experience with health-care terminology and related data is strongly preferred. Master’s Degree in a quantitative field is preferred.

Knowledge Requirements: Knowledge of statistical principles and analysis.
Technical Requirements: Knowledge of database query/programming language(s) – SQL and/or XQuery. Experience with or knowledge of database structures and technologies. Advanced proficiency in Tableau and Excel. Proficiency in SAS, R, Python, Alteryx, or other data transformation software.
Abilities Requirements:
Ability to multitask and meet deadlines. Ability to learn business case uses for data analytics and research at the AHA. Must be a team player who can consider impacts and implications on a broad, enterprise-wide scale.
BENEFITS We offer an excellent total compensation package, which includes medical/dental coverage (PPO/HMO), vision care, life insurance, short and long-term disability plans, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid vacation/holidays/sick days, wellness programs and more! The American Hospital Association (AHA) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. We will provide reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974 and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please call (312) 422-3000 and ask for the Director, Human Resources and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. The AHA participates in the E-Verify Program.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description:
CVS/Caremark, the Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) division of CVS Health, is looking for a Healthcare Data Analyst to join our Eligibility Administration Department. As a Healthcare Data Analyst for a Fortune 10 organization, you will impact and support customers/clients in all areas including Commercial, Medicare, Healthcare Plans & Group Waiver Plans (EGWP).

Primary responsibilities of the Healthcare Data Analyst include:
Acting as a healthcare data subject matter expert on Eligibility guidelines and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) protocol for clients Researching and consulting to improve healthcare data integrity and ensure excellent service delivery Constantly improving healthcare analytical skills that are needed to perform data analysis Resolving data enrollment issues on a daily basis Consulting on healthcare data needs Having exceptional time management and healthcare client management skills Continuous development training will be provided in this role to ensure the Healthcare Data Analyst is able to exceed client expectations in this fast-paced environment
Required Qualifications
1+ years in healthcare data eligibility, insurance, IT, benefits or data analytics environment with a strong ability to work independently, problem solve, and analyze data in a confidential healthcare environment.
Preferred Qualifications
3+ years in eligibility or other relevant background2+ years customer service or client-facing experience in a fast-paced environmentExperience in EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)Understanding of the PBM industryKnowledge of ANSI X12 834 Data DocumentsFamiliarity with RxClaim and/or AS400
