title: Financial Analyst
description:
Apply on line at http://www.alohacare.org/Careers/Default.aspx The Company: AlohaCare is a local, non-profit health plan serving the Medicaid and Medicare dual eligible population. We provide comprehensive managed care to qualifying health plan members through well-established partnerships with quality health care providers and community-governed health centers. Our mission is to serve individuals and communities in the true spirit of aloha by ensuring and advocating access to quality health care for all. This is accomplished with emphasis on prevention and primary care through community health centers that founded us and continue to guide us as well as with others that share our commitment. As Hawaii’s third-largest health plan, AlohaCare offers comprehensive prevention, primary and specialty care coverage in order to successfully build a healthy Hawaii. The Culture: AlohaCare employees share a passion for helping Hawaii’s most underserved communities. This passion for helping and caring for others is internalized and applied to our employees through a supportive and positive work environment, healthy work/life balance, continuous communication and a generous benefits package. AlohaCare’s leadership empowers and engages its employees through frequent diversity, recognition, community, and educational events and programs. AlohaCare has a strong commitment to support Hawaii’s families and reinforces a healthy work/home balance for its employees. Because AlohaCare values honesty, respect and trust with both our internal and external customers, we encourage open-door, two-way communication through daily interactions, employee events and quarterly all-staff meetings. AlohaCare’s comprehensive benefits package includes low cost medical, dental, drug and vision insurance, PTO program, 401k employer contribution, referral bonus and pretax transportation and parking program. These employee-focused efforts contribute to a friendly, team-oriented culture which is positively reflected into the communities we serve. Position Summary: Support AlohaCare’s finance department in the retrieval, analysis and reporting on data to assist management in making well informed financial decisions. Conducts ad hoc analyses, prepares reports and presents information. Primary Duties & Responsibilities: Designs and develops database queries, extracts data from databases and analyzes the data using a variety of analytical techniques. Prepares accurate reports and presents findings.Performs utilization analysis utilizing data from different sources and reports results.Provides data and analytical support for department and organizational initiatives.Maintains medical and drug utilization dashboardManage and monitor monthly inpatient expense report.Manage and calculate Medicare broker commissions. Responsible for maintaining an accurate record of payments and preparing monthly payments and reports.Prepare reports as needed.Performs other duties as assigned.Responsible to maintain AlohaCare’s confidential information in accordance with AlohaCare policies, and state and federal laws, rules and regulations regarding confidentiality. Employees have access to AlohaCare data based on the data classification assigned to this job title. *
Required Competencies & Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree with emphasis in computer science, information systems, mathematics, statistics, public health, health sciences, data analysis, accounting or health care administration2-3 years professional training or work experience which demonstrates the ability to perform the duties required for the position.Equivalent combination of education and experiencePrior experience using Access, SQL, Excel and other statistical/analytical tools.Knowledge of relational databases and structures.Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills.Experience with computer systems and software programs (e.g. SQL, reporting tools, Microsoft Office, and Stata/SAS/SPSS or equivalent statistical package).Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with cross functional teams.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.Achieves results, builds trust, communicate effectively, detail-oriented, and customer and quality focused.Ability to multi-task, organize, adapt to changing priorities, and manage a diversity of high priority projects in a fast-paced environment.Strong work ethic with a positive, can-do attitudeRequires operation of general office equipment to include; PC, fax/copy machine and ACD Mitel Phones.Advanced skill using Microsoft Programs; Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and OutlookPreferred Qualifications: * 3-5 years related experience or equivalent.Health care industry experience within managed care, hospital, medical office or equivalent preferred. Physical Demands/Working Conditions: Inside working conditions.*No environmental hazards.*Sedentary Work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met. AlohaCare is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all applicants in accordance with sound practices and federal and state laws. Our policy prohibits discrimination and harassment because of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity or expression), pregnancy, age, national origin, ancestry, marital status, arrest and court record), disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, domestic or sexual violence victim status, credit history, citizenship status, military/veterans status, or other characteristics protected under applicable state and federal laws, regulations, and/or executive orders. Job Type: Full-time Experience: professional training or similiar work: 2 years (Preferred) Location: Honolulu, HI (Required) Work Location: One location Benefits: Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time off

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst
description:
Wake up every morning with the potential to change lives, and the tools to make it happen. EBS is the top choice for BCBA’s who strive to help children learn, progress and grow! Join our team and we will provide everything you need in order fuel your passion and advance your career as a behavior therapist. 
 Whether you are new to the field or an experienced BCBA looking to reinvigorate your career, we offer nationwide and local opportunities, including: 
 Top-ranked public, private and charter schoolsClinical settingsIn-home treatment 
 Here at EBS, you have the power to build your career to its greatest potential. That’s why so many BCBA’s choose and stay with EBS each year. We strive to apply the best practices through Applied Behavior Analysis, with the opportunity for you to expand your career in whatever way you choose. Treat in a specific specialty area. Study abroad. Become a supervisor. Whatever your dream- EBS can help you make it happen! 
 Benefits:  
 Competitive salaryMedical, dental and vision insuranceFlexible schedule401KSign-on-bonusesRelocation assistanceSchool and clinic settings offering consistent hoursCareer paths to challenge you in each stage of your careerUnlimited access to trainings and continuing educationAccess to an unbelievable network of top therapists who share your level of dedicationA 24 hour support lineA licensure department that can assist you in obtaining required state licensure, if applicableAn entire team of Career Specialists who will support you professionally and personally as you grow with EBS! 
 BCBA Therapist Qualifications:  
 Conduct initial and ongoing client assessments and based on these assessments, design and maintain top quality treatment programs.Familiar with FBA’s and BSP’sOversee and maintain accurate organized client notes, data and reports for internal and external stakeholders.Train teachers, classroom staff and family members on treatment techniques; maintain positive working relationships with clients’ families; respond to guardian questions in a timely and professional manner; minimize cancellations of scheduled sessions. 
 About EBS:  
 Educational Based Services is the largest independent provider of services for the school-based, pediatric population. We believe that each and every child has the power to grow and succeed. That is why the members of our team are the most dedicated people in the therapy, behavior and special education field. We care more. We do more. We are EBS. Read more about us and the difference we make at www.ebshealthcare.com

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview The purpose of the Data Analyst is to collect, analyze and model data insights that help drive better marketing and sales decisions. This role will be directly responsible for using data to analyze prospective and current client trends to direct insights that will grow our organization and market presence through the lens of our company strategy.

Responsibilities
Data Collection & Migration. Identifies valuable data sources and automates collection processes. Undertakes preprocessing of data that is both structured and unstructured. Analyzing & Modeling Data. Builds forecasting models and algorithms to analyze large amounts of complex information to discover trends and patterns.Organizes insights and recommendations using various techniques that translate into non-technical terms for business understanding. Collaboration. Collaborates with various internal departments to provide support on various projects. Ability to work with stakeholders to assess risks and propose solutions and strategies to overcome various challenges.

What we're looking for Prior experience as a Data Analyst Strong business acumen and inclination for problem-solving Enjoys collaborating with others Excellent level of written and verbal communication skills

Qualifications Minimum Requirements: 5+ years of experience as a data analyst or in related field. Knowledge of R, SAS, SQL, and Excel. Experience using Business Intelligence Tools and data frameworks with large data sets and relational databases Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Preferred Requirements: Experience working with Hubspot and SalesForce

title: Open Source Analyst
description:
Key Role:
Consult on how to leverage open source intelligence (OSINT) data and information, use specialized OSINT tools and services, and consult on the development of OSINT products. Support the development of new OSINT targeting and exploitation techniques and broadly apply knowledge to analyze the development of OSINT policy and tradecraft. Leverage analytical expertise to work as an open source analyst providing cutting-edge OSINT collection and analysis, including social media exploitation and big or bulk data exploitation to support the client. Use advanced OSINT and social media collection and analysis techniques to support information requests concerning force protection, indications and warnings, counter threats, counterintelligence, and all source intelligence integration and assessments. Support risk assessments across a wide range of topics, including transnational and critical infrastructure threats, military capabilities, leadership intentions, and threat networks. Lead the planning and implementation of analytical programs and interface regularly with senior management and Combatant Command leadership.
Basic Qualifications:3+ years of experience with conducting open source research, all-source intelligence analysis, or targetingExperience with accessing, researching, and exploiting global and regional social media and digital platformsKnowledge of Indo-Pacific politics, foreign policy, military, and trending threatsKnowledge of advanced Internet-based research, including Boolean logic, advanced research techniques, search engine and database resources, and Internet sources, including social media, social networking tools, and commercial and industry-based databasesAbility to employ behavioral and technical research methodologies and tradecraft and brief client leadership and colleagues on results of research succinctlyActive TS/SCI clearanceHS diploma or GED
Additional Qualifications:Knowledge of scripting languages and technologies, including Python, Java, R Script, and JEMAAbility to show fluency in an Indo-Pacific language
BA or BS degreeApproved intelligence community, DoD, or Army OSINT Training or equivalent
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

company: City and County of Honolulu, HI
title: DATA PROCESSING SYSTEMS ANALYST I (SR
description:
Assists in the design and development of electronic data processing systems and procedures for functionally distinct activities of an organization and carries out assigned phases thereof independently; analyzes and evaluates operating methods and practices relative to the information needs of specific programs and activities; and performs other related duties as required.
Vacancies in Application Development Section: Independently performs assignments to assist with the analysis, design, development, implementation, maintenance, and support of departmental enterprise systems. Presently working with a consultant to modify and implement a third-party application at the Honolulu Board of Water Supply.

Vacancies in Infrastructure Support Section: Responsible for maintaining and supporting, and assists in implementing and managing large and complex computer infrastructure and networking systems for functionally distinct activities.
Additional Job Information: At time of application, you must be a citizen, national or permanent resident alien of the United States or a non-citizen eligible under federal law for unrestricted employment.
***Salary amount may be subject to pay adjustments***

1) Only ONLINE applications will be accepted.

2) Paper applications will NOT be accepted.

All vacancies are with the Honolulu Board of Water Supply (HBWS). There are two vacancies are in the Application Development Section and two vacancies in the Infrastructure Support Section. This list may be used for future vacancies in these and other departments. Important Notice: Some notifications may be sent via e-mail. You are responsible for monitoring instructions and correspondence from this office by checking your email account in a timely manner. To ensure proper delivery, please make sure you:
use a valid e-mail account;verify your e-mail address is entered correctly on your GovernmentJobs account;are subscribed to email notices;check your spam folders; andadd infoneogov@honolulu.gov and info@governmentjobs.com to your contact list.
Minimum Qualification Requirements: EDUCATION REQUIREMENT:
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited college or university with major work in Computer Science, Public or Business Administration, Accounting, Mathematics or a related field.

Verification Requirement: You must submit evidence of your education within 7 days of filing this application. A reproduced copy of your diploma and/or transcript which shows the embossed seal must be submitted in order to be given credit. Copies will not be returned. Mail or drop off: Department of Human Resources, 650 South King Street, 10th Floor, Honolulu, HI 96813.

Substitution: Work experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year-for-year basis. Such experience must have provided the knowledge, skills, and analytical ability normally gained from attainment of a bachelor's degree.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT:
One year of experience in the analysis of operating practices, methods, and procedures, some of which shall have involved the conduct of feasibility studies and the analysis and design of systems for the electronic processing of data.

Substitution:
1) A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or MIS from an accredited university may be substituted for six months of the experience requirement.
2) A Master's degree in Computer Science or MIS from an accredited university may be substituted for the one year experience requirement.

Verification Requirement: You must submit evidence of your education within 7 days of filing this application. A reproduced copy of your diploma and/or transcript which shows the embossed seal must be submitted in order to be given credit. Copies will not be returned. Mail or drop off: Department of Human Resources, 650 South King Street, 10th Floor, Honolulu, HI 96813.
Examination Process: EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE EVALUATION: In addition to meeting the above minimum qualifications, your application will be further evaluated. Your score will be based on the quality, quantity and/or recency of your education and experience. Failure to provide sufficient information may result in your application being rejected or your receiving a lower grade. Do NOT submit a copy of your resume or position description in lieu of providing detailed and complete information on your application form.

EXAMINATION WEIGHT:
Education and Experience Evaluation . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 100%

title: Business Analyst I (Akamai Advantage Dual Care)
description:

The Business Analyst I assists with the oversight of the operational needs of the Akamai Advantage Dual Care Service Coordination program. This includes supporting decision making, measuring and managing productivity, and complying with accreditation standards and CMS requirements. The Business Analyst I will develop good working relationships with business users at all levels to understand their goals and deliver business solutions.

Assists with unit activities for maintaining and supporting compliance with accreditation standards and contract requirements, including:
unit reporting needs

Serves as a resource to internal and external staff regarding issues related to the Akamai Advantage Dual Care program and the Model of Care program document.
Provides training to Service Coordinators based on issues identified through quality review.
Organizes, plans, implements, and tracks activities and projects for the Akamai Advantage Dual Care program. Gathers business requirements to determine project timeframes. Prepares recommendations for consideration by management based on analysis of project results.
Other duties as assigned.
Exempt or Non-Exempt
Exempt

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organization and time management skills

title: Corporate Services Analyst
description:
Primary Purpose of Job
Oversees activities and functions of the Corporate Services department including outsourced areas. Identifies sources of products and services to satisfy needs of the Bank and commercial markets. Formulates and provides input to the corporate strategic plan, business plan and operating budget as they relate to Corporate Services. Major Job Accountabilities Oversees and contributes to the validation of service invoices and costs for existing services. Contributes to budget preparation and control. Maintain records for review and evaluation and perform special management studies for input to contract negotiations. Ability to communicate with various business partners and setup meetings for collaboration concerning current or future services needed for the organization. Follow and monitor business plans and strategies to ensure effective, efficient, customer-oriented operations in support of the branches, departments, as well as the corporate strategic plan and objectives. Includes (but not limited to): Researching and evaluating opportunities to centralize operations to improve the performance of Corporate Services; Contributes and participates in the testing of system analysis and software development for projects of significant complexity
Education Requirements High School Diploma or Equivalent Associates Degree in Business Administration or Accounting is preferred

Minimum Experience Required Minimum three (3) years of experience in financial data processing, production processing activities, account management, or procurement. Minimum three (3) years of demonstrated work experience and comprehensive knowledge of bank operations, host systems and related applications, legal and regulatory compliance requirements and processes, network and data communication infrastructure Required Skills or Training Proficient in the use of a PC and all Microsoft software applications Able to provide input for contract generation, negotiation and vendor management to include analysis of monthly reports and holding vendors accountable to published Service Level Agreements. title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
Data Governance Analyst - 1900734 Description Bank of Hawaii In 1897, Bank of Hawaii was the first chartered and incorporated bank in the Republic of Hawaii. We’ve been here from territorial days, growing and changing with Hawaii. Today, we are the largest independent bank in Hawaii – a result of knowing our business and community, and always staying ahead of change. We are constantly finding creative ways to deliver leading edge financial services to our customers. Now, we’re embracing change with our new 21st century banking.
It’s our people who help us succeed in offering first class service and products to our customers. As a member of the Bank of Hawaii community, you will be among the very best in your profession in an environment that places a high value on integrity, innovation and teamwork. People who are agile, savvy, forward-thinking and entrepreneurial can learn and grow with us.
Does this sound like you? Are you ambitious? Want to make a difference in people’s lives? Do you thrive in an environment that leverages your abilities as a fast learner, good listener, and problem-solver? If you love challenges, relish complexity, and have moxie, consider applying your unique talents with a Hawaii banking leader – Bank of Hawaii. Here you can be at the forefront of whatever you do. Welcome to your tomorrow!
A day in your life as a Data Governance Analyst: Under the direction of the Manager, this position is responsible for the bridging the gaps between business areas throughout the Bank, assisting improvement in data integrity and quality and ensuring internal policies and procedures for the storage and handling of sensitive customer information (personal and financial), and corporate confidential information. Ensures business unit’s compliance with applicable laws, regulation, regulatory requirements and Bank policies and procedures, including but not limited to those related to Fair Banking, Anti-Money Laundering laws and regulations, Bank Secrecy Act and USA PATRIOT Act.
We’ll give you these important responsibilities… Evaluates critical data for integrity and accuracy. Works with business units across the organization in support of data governance. Ensures that the appropriate policies and procedures are in place for data quality, consistency and synchronization across multiple system environments. Trains data stakeholders and business units on key data governance initiatives. Understands the impact of data within the organization and systems. Assists the Data Governance Manager in developing and overseeing a data governance framework for the organization. Guides development teams to automate manual information functionalities, wherever applicable. Monitors progress of Data Governance initiatives. Assists in the development, coordination, implementation of processes related to data documentation and data mapping. Drives internal control and process compliance through active understanding, engagement, and awareness. Provides problem-solving support, advice and guidance to data stakeholders across the organization. Assists in establishing technical solutions to enhance accountability, standards and procedures, quality control, and monitoring and measurement of progress.
Qualifications …if you come to us with these qualifications…
Education: Bachelor’s degree from accredited institution in Business or related field or equivalent work experience.
Experience: Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, data governance, or information systems in a banking or financial institution environment. Experience with methodical application of established data governance standards and working collaboratively and communicating effectively with key stakeholders. Experience with Workflow development involving Data Management and data lifecycle is a plus.
Technical Skills: Demonstrated proficiency and advance expertise with personal computers and Microsoft applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and SharePoint) or similar software.
Other Job Qualifications: Ability to understand data cause and effect on downstream processes. Strong attention to detail, thoroughness and consistency in the execution of responsibilities. Ability to deliver written and oral communication in a clear, concise, and relevant to the audience. Strong organizational and problem solving skills; solution rather than problem focused. Ability to work cross-functionally and to learn and adapt to new business processes, technologies, and environments.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any legally protected classification including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. Bank of Hawaii takes affirmative action in support of its policy to advance in employment legally recognized individuals including minorities, women, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

location: J B P H H, HI 96860
title: Research Analyst (part time, temporary)
description:
Join the HJF Team! HJF is seeking a Research Analyst to support the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency (DPAA) Partnerships and Innovations (PI) Directorate researcher contractor position. HJF provides scientific, technical and programmatic support services to DPAA. This position is part time temporary working 20 hours/week. The researcher will provide professional assistance pertaining to DPAA’s partner-related activities. The researcher assists in locating and analyzing sources of information related to military conflicts, battles, and battle casualties. Travel may be on military and commercial aircraft. This position regularly interfaces with employees, consultants, partners, and contractors, and communicates through briefings and written products with Agency leadership, U.S. Government employees, family members, foreign officials, and partners as well as potential partners. Key Tasks:

Assist with the planning and implementation of field activity-related partnerships to contribute to DPAA’s mission.
Occasionally travel for partnership development or assistance, or other activities as required by DPAA.
Complies with all DPAA requirements for writing reports. Coordinates all issues and research results through all appropriate channels.
Protect organization’s value by keeping information confidential.
Work directly and independently with clients.
Follow all client policies and procedures.
Other duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Comprehensive knowledge of the Southeast Asia Conflict with a heavy concentration concerning the unaccounted-for Americans in the Lao People’s Democratic Republic.
Comprehensive knowledge of the required DPAA reports that support mission planning and Family Updates.
Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient in MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat.
A demonstrated history of initiative and achievement.
A demonstrated history of working independently with client staff.
Experience working independently with minimal direction or supervision.
Experience supporting and anticipating client needs and demonstrating problem-solve skills.
Experience performing tasks under tight deadlines and managing shifting priorities. Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:

BA in archeology, history or related degree
Must have a Defense Language Proficiency Test of a minimum of 2+ in reading and a /2+ in listening in order to effectively be able to translate and peer review junior linguist translations.
At least 10 years of full-time professional experience or equivalent specialized training in the Southeast Asia Conflict with expertise concerning the unaccounted-for Americans as well as the resolved incidents in the Lao People’s Democratic Republic.
Demonstrated experience in conducting large-scale, detailed research in order to write incident historical reports.
Demonstrated ability to work independently on projects to completion as well as in a team environment.
Detailed oriented. Physical Requirements:
The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Ability to access information using a computer for up to 4 hours at a time.
Requires sitting at a desk for long periods of time.
Incumbent must be capable of working in stressful situations with short deadlines. Background: US Citizenship is required; ability to obtain a Common Access Card (CAC); Public Trust background. Employment with HJF is contingent upon successful completion of a background check, which may include, but is not limited to, contacting your professional references, verification of previous employment, addresses, education, and credentials, a criminal background check, drug screening, and a department of motor vehicle (DMV) check. HJF is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Any qualifications to be considered as equivalents, in lieu of stated minimums, require the prior approval of the Chief Human Resources Officer.

title: E
description:

title: Budget and Awards Analyst
description:
Job Summary
Works on awarding and disbursements for all scholarship programs and financial aid support, ensuring fair, accurate, consistent, and timely processing within program policy and guidelines.
Essential Responsibilities
Operations and Processing
Reviews and supports reporting of all scholarship programs and financial aid programs. Performs validation of program data eligibility, and accurate awarding per program guidelines. Processes all reconsideration and Professional Judgement requests for all scholarship programs. Serves as back up for all award and disbursement processing to include timely completion of annual process documentation. Prepares statistical reports for program eligibility and awarding process with the application of KS’ preference policy as appropriate ensuring fair, timely, accurate, and consistent awarding. Prepares and ensures accurate and timely program disbursements for all scholarships and posting of cash receipts and returns for all KS programs. Ensures the tracking, processing and implementation of fiscal and reconciliation controls of applicant notification and payments, including award, denial, repayment, cancellations, revision and reconsideration letters, check requisitions, returns, etc. Prepares various reports accurately and timely on a regular basis. Communicates clearly with students and/or families to keep recipients on track to meet award terms and conditions. Processes, reviews and validates submitted post award documents to ensure timely disbursement of awards. Provides consistent communications regarding outstanding requirements.
Systems
Supports all “back office” awarding (including packaging) and disbursement programming and updates for all department database systems. Maintains knowledge of the RFR and RFV process for all programs and responsible for RFV reviews. Works with other departments and IT to understand operational and processing needs from program planning, testing, rollout and implementation. Executes queries for all department systems to support business, statistical and operational reporting. Ensures data integrity of department’s systems. Serves as a member of the department Program Planning management team
Programs
Participates in department program planning for all scholarship programs by conceptually determining operations of current or new programs within established policy. Supports Kamehameha Schools’ educational and financial aid programs by providing requested and ad-hoc data and reports. Develops process maps and supports QC programs as necessary to ensure the integrity of department programs.
Position Requirements
Minimum Qualifications - An equivalent combination of education and experience may substitute for the requirements listed.
Associate’s Degree.
Minimum 3 years of direct related experience.
Strong working knowledge of computerized accounting systems and advanced skills in MS Office (Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook).
Familiar with fundamental accounting principles (matching, conservatism, recognition, etc.) and working knowledge of cash and accrual accounting.
Knowledge of separation of duties, processes, and internal controls in a business environment and experience with internal control evaluation, documentation, and implementation.
Excellent organizational skills to prioritize and handle complex, multiple, and simultaneous projects and meet established timelines and deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to remain flexible and adapt to a demanding and rapidly changing work environment including fielding 20+ inquiries per day.
Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to work effectively with management and staff at various levels in the organization, as well as applicants and family members with varying levels of fiscal and financial aid knowledge.
Strong business documentation skills
Ability to analyze and interpret highly confidential information with a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to process, analyze, reconcile, and interpret financial data for reporting, problem-resolution, and internal control evaluation.
Ability to work independently without constant supervision and to recognize and take action when noting tasks needing to be performed.
Ability to be flexible and to learn new systems and processes as required.
Preferred Qualifications
1-2 years of accounting or internal controls experience.
Good understanding of KS organizational structure, processes, and operations.
Previous experience with educational institutions and financial aid/scholarships.
Knowledge of computer systems, capabilities, and processes (i.e. TADs, Powerfaids).
Physical Requirements
Frequently sit, perform desk based computer tasks and grasp light/fine manipulation.
Occasionally stand/walk, write by hand, and lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.
Rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat, kneel, crawl, climb, reach/work above shoulder, grasp forcefully.
Working Conditions
This position may involve traveling to various locations, including neighbor islands to conduct business.
Work is conducted in an office/school environment and may require work to be conducted in non-standard workplaces.
Work is typically conducted Monday through Friday at normal business hours but evening and weekend hours may be required to meet goals and objectives.
Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by incumbents assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities, duties and skills required. The incumbent may be expected to perform other duties as assigned.

title: Project Analyst (Limited Term)
description:
Job Summary
Provides project specific data, program, and operational analyses and support to project teams. Plans and implements low to moderate risk projects, and low to moderate risk portions of projects on larger initiatives. Works with project managers in all aspects of planning, implementation and closure of moderate to high-risk projects.
Essential Responsibilities
Collects and analyzes requested data. Provides data, program, and operational analyses. Creates and maintains project documentation, metrics, budgets and schedules. Provides project analysis, management reports, and communications. Evaluates current practices. Develops analyses and reports; provides information and/or presents findings, summaries and recommendations.
Plans, executes, controls and reports low-risk projects, or portions of projects, within the constraints of scope, cost, quality, time and stakeholder expectations.
Facilitates and runs meetings, documents results, tracks issues, and ensures resolution.
Works to build and manage client relationships. Supports the attainment of client strategies.
Performs other related duties as assigned or requested.
Position Requirements
Minimum Qualifications - An equivalent combination of education and experience may substitute for the requirements listed.
Bachelor's in Education, Business Administration, Humanities or related fields.
One year analytical experience.
Ability to work in a collaborative environment. Ability to work independently.
Strong written and oral presentation skills. Strong communication skills.
Ability to understand complex processes and simplify and streamline processes. Knowledge of the project management process.
Ability to design and implement organization structure and process changes across multiple delivery and support units.
Ability to perform numerical / financial analysis.
Excellent organization skills and attention to detail.
Ability to use standard PC applications (word processing, spreadsheet, database, presentation, email/calendaring).
Strong working knowledge of and experience in automating office processes using standard office desktop applications.
Ability to be flexible.
Demonstrated knowledge of and/or skill in organizational competencies of accountability, change effectiveness, collaboration and teamwork, communication, Hawaiian cultural commitment, and innovation.
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of and experience in educational settings.
Familiarity with KS operations.
Physical Requirements
Frequently sits, perform desk-based computer tasks and grasp light or fine manipulation, talk or hear.
Occasionally stand and/or walk, write by hand, and lift and/or carry, push and/or pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.
Rarely twist, bend, stoop, squat, kneel, crawl, climb, reach or work above shoulder, or grasp forcefully.
Working Conditions
This position may involve traveling to various locations, including neighbor islands to conduct business.
Work is conducted in an office environment and may require work to be conducted in non-standard workplaces.
Work is typically conducted Monday through Friday at normal business hours.
Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by incumbents assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities, duties and skills required. The incumbent may be expected to perform other duties as assigned.

title: Systems Analyst
description:
The Technical Systems Analyst is responsible to investigate and resolve software and hardware problems. Reviews all computer hardware and software related purchases and assures balance CPU loads and alternating network configurations, assure maintenance of data integrity. Subject matter expert in the area of hospital software and hardware usage. Provides desktop support and serves as back up for Network/Applications Specialist role in the area of LAN/WAN network support. Works closely with IS Manager to ensure efficient functioning of the overall information systems. Other areas include Active Directory and E-mail Accounts Management, Computer Application Development, Project Management, and Customer Training/Service. 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Experience: 
 IT networks support, hardware and software applications: 3 years (Required) 
 Education: 
 Bachelor's (Preferred) 
 License: 
 MSCA or MSCE (Preferred) 
 Work Location: 
 One location 
 Benefits: 
 Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursement
